item.title: Pope Leo makes AI’s threat to humanity a signature issue
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Pope Leo XIV, the new American pope, is making the threat of AI to humanity a key issue of his legacy.

item.title: After Shopify bought his last startup, Birk Jernström wants to help developers build one-person unicorns
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: With Polar as their ‘Merchant of Record’ responsible for handling billing and taxes, developers can sell online products and SaaS subscriptions globally from day one.

item.title: Police shut down Cluely’s party, the ‘cheat at everything’ startup
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: The latest San Francisco startup culture drama happened on Monday night. And it occurred over “the most legendary party that never happened."

item.title: Sam Altman says Meta tried and failed to poach OpenAI’s talent with $100M offers
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman said that Meta tried to poach its employees with nine-figure offers, but failed to recruit OpenAI's best people.

item.title: OpenAI’s $200M DoD contract could squeeze frenemy Microsoft
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: The contract could put the model maker in competition with the OpenAI services that Microsoft wants to sell to the DoD.

item.title: EVs dominate the most American-made cars index and it’s not just because of Tesla
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Tesla, Kia, and Volkswagen took six of the top 10 spots in the 2025 American-Made Index, which ranks vehicles built and bought in the U.S.

item.title: Google’s Gemini panicked when playing Pokémon
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: AI companies are battling to dominate the industry, but sometimes they’re also battling in Pokémon gyms. As Google and Anthropic both study how their latest AI models navigate early Pokémon games, the results can be as amusing as they are enlightening — and this time, Google DeepMind has written in a report that Gemini 2.5 […]

item.title: A comprehensive list of 2025 tech layoffs
item.dc:creator: Cody Corrall, Alyssa Stringer, Kate Park
item.description: A complete list of all the known layoffs in tech, from Big Tech to startups, broken down by month throughout 2024.

item.title: Amazon expects to reduce corporate jobs due to AI
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy expects that AI automations will both change how people work and change the number of people needed.

item.title: Meta is reportedly building AI smart glasses with Prada, too
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Meta is reportedly working on a pair of AI smart glasses with Prada.

item.title: Tumblr’s content-filtering systems have been falsely flagging posts as ‘mature,’ users blame AI
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Tumblr users are complaining that content is being falsely labeled as mature, the latest tech company to grapple with automated flagging and takedowns.

item.title: Unlock purpose-driven growth at TechCrunch All Stage, and get $210 off for 6 more days
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: T-minus 6 days until TechCrunch All Stage ticket prices rise. From now until June 22 at 11:59 p.m. PT, founders save $210 and investors save $200 on passes. Are you ready to push your startup to the next level? Or are you an investor looking to back the next big breakthrough? Join TC All Stage […]

item.title: Applied Intuition raises $600M as it pushes further into defense
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The buzzy AI-powered autonomous vehicle software company doubles its valuation from last year -- and then some.

item.title: Facebook announces that all videos on its platform will soon be shared as reels
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Facebook announced on Tuesday that all videos on its platform will soon be shared as reels, regardless of their length or orientation.

item.title: Intel to lay off up to 20% of Intel Foundry workers
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Rumors of these layoffs began back in April as Intel looks to refocus on its core business units and shed additional bloat.

item.title: Pro-Israel hacktivist group claims responsibility for alleged Iranian bank hack
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: The apparent cyberattack comes as Israel and Iran engage in a days-long escalating military conflict.

item.title: In just 3 months, Ramp’s valuation jumped to $16B, up from $13B
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Spend management startup Ramp announced on Tuesday that it raised a $200 million Series E led by its largest investor, Founders Fund.

item.title: Anysphere launches a $200-a-month Cursor AI coding subscription
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Anysphere launched a new $200-a-month subscription plan for its popular AI coding tool, Cursor, the company announced in a blog post on Monday. The new plan, Ultra, offers users 20x more usage on AI models from OpenAI, Anthropic, Google DeepMind, and xAI compared to the company’s $20-a-month subscription plan, Pro. Anysphere also says Cursor users […]

item.title: Threads expands open social web integrations with fediverse feed, user profile search
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Posts from federated users will be found on the Following tab of the Threads app.

item.title: Waymo robotaxis are pushing into even more California cities
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Waymo is expanding its commercial robotaxi service area by another 80 square miles, a move that brings its driverless vehicles into new parts of Los Angeles, Silicon Valley, and the San Francisco Bay Area.
